page.title: 04KOI CARP IN BRIGHOUSE
page.content: LIFE STYLES Koi Carp are ornamental fish from Japan and they come in sizes ranging from tiddlers of a few inches long to giants at nearly three feet.A local man started like most enthusiasts by keeping a few fish in a large tank in his living room. He then began to sell a few to his friends; the trade grew and he gave up his job to concentrate on Koi Carp. Koi range in colour from shiny silvery white ones to bright black red and white ones. The business started in a disused church hall.Prices ranged from Â£5 for a few centimetres of fish well up into four figures for a sixty centimetre plus specimen. The most expensive Koi he had for sale was Â£3,5OO but newcomers to the hobby tended to spend up to Â£3O per fish.
